Hi German,
You need to have a space between O and 1, like this:  -O 1.
It used to be without a space, but I guess it was changed when it got added to Radiance.
A segfault is not a good thing regardless, so we should probably do something to avoid the segfault from mis-use.
Andy




On Mon, Jan 7, 2013 at 2:51 PM, Germán Molina Larrain <gmolina1 at uc.cl<mailto:gmolina1 at uc.cl>> wrote:
Dear Radiancers,


I have recently installed the LNBL precompiled binaries for Mac on a Mountain Lion OS 10.8; and when trying to get the solar intensity of the sky (gendaylit - blah blah blah -O1) it says "Segmentation fault: 11". After that, I tried using the HEAD release from some days ago, on Linux, and same deal "Segmentation fault (core dumpted)".


The same sky, without the O option does not return an error, but whenever I put O1, O2 or O0, it throws back a segmentation fault.


Is this a known issue? what can I do to avoid it?


THANKS VERY MUCH


German Molina
